intro: Gochnatia australis, commonly known as the Australian gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense, spherical heads. Gochnatia australis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
